STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 21, 2023
Felisha M Glutsch
Ennis Center For Children - Flint
129 E 3rd ST,
Flint, MI, 48502-1728
RE: License#: CB250201108
Dear Ms. Glutsch:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 02/16/2023 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not
result in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 734-395 -0920
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012
Enclosure
Robert Ennis
Angela Dore

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Flint, MI 48502-1728

homes for license, Supervise Independent
Living, Place children in foster home,
Evaluate Applicants for adoption

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722 – O8D Treatment plans Agreement and Signature:
Once completed and approved, the caseworker
Must obtain signatures from the following
Individuals, as applicable:
• Foster parents, relative caregivers, and
Unrelated court ordered caregivers.
Three of six current foster care files were noncompliant. In these three files,
three of 21 parent agency treatment plans reviewed were not signed timely.
One youth treatment plan dated 09/01/21 – 11/24/21, the birth mother
signed on 01/05/22.
Second youth report dated 02/07/2022 – 05/07/2022, the foster parent
signed on 06/17/2022.
Third youth report dated 04/27/2022 – 07/20/22, the boxes were not
checked indicating that the caregiver participated in the service plan.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Ensure documentation of youth grades, along with letters sent to the school,
are in the document section for review.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one corrective action plans during this period under review.
The interim inspection dated 04/26/2022, and the CAP was accepted on 08/17/2022.
The agency was in noncompliance with rules 400.12418 (2a) Development of
service plan, 400.12418 (2b) Development of service plan and DHHS Policy 722-
08C Required participation in Development – Foster Parent, Caregiver.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The CAA discussed that the CAP brought attention to areas that needed oversight
and attention. The CA discussed why the last CAP was unsuccessful due to high
turnover of staff including supervisory staff and how the current administration is
correcting the issues. The biggest struggle is to maintain the staff recently hired.
Financial Overview
The agency submitted their annual budget report, it showed a surplus for their fiscal
year. Tax return was observed.
Staff Interviews
Overall, staff interviewed were relatively new but very enthusiastic about their job
and helping children and families. They reported getting support from their
supervisors and Chief Administrator.
Description of Agency Walk Through
There were no safety issue concerns.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
02/16/2023
_____________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
02/21/2023

Kari Muntean Date
